dt: {bc}the distance from the end of the thumb to the end of the little finger of a spread hand
{bc}an English unit of length equal to nine inches (22.9 centimeters)
{bc}an extent, stretch, reach, or spread between two limits: such as
{bc}the spread or extent between abutments or supports (as of a bridge)
{bc}the maximum distance laterally from tip to tip of an airplane

et: Middle English, from Old English {it}spann{/it}; akin to Old High German {it}spanna{/it} span, Middle Dutch {it}spannen{/it} to stretch, hitch up
shortdef: the distance from the end of the thumb to the end of the little finger of a spread hand; also : an English unit of length equal to nine inches (22.9 centimeters)
an extent, stretch, reach, or spread between two limits: such as
a limited space (as of time); especially : an individual's lifetime

dt: {bc}to measure by or as if by the hand with fingers and thumb extended
{bc}to place or construct a span over
{bc}to be capable of expressing any element of under given operations

dt.t: a set of vectors that {wi}spans{/wi} a vector space

shortdef: to measure by or as if by the hand with fingers and thumb extended

dt: {bc}a pair of animals (such as mules) usually matched in appearance and action and driven together

et: Dutch, from Middle Dutch, from {it}spannen{/it} to hitch up
shortdef: a pair of animals (such as mules) usually matched in appearance and action and driven together

et: Middle English, partial translation of Old Norse {it}spānnȳr{/it}, from {it}spānn{/it} chip of wood + {it}nȳr{/it} new

dt: {bc}the length of time during which one (such as an individual or a group) is able to concentrate or remain interested

shortdef: the length of time during which one (such as an individual or a group) is able to concentrate or remain interested

dt: used for a nonprofit television network specializing in televised government proceedings and other public affairs programming

shortdef: —used for a nonprofit television network specializing in televised government proceedings and other public affairs programming

dt: {bc}the length of time in one's life during which an individual is in reasonably good health

dt.t: A revolutionary increase in life span has already occurred. A corresponding increase in {wi}health span{/wi}, the maintenance of full function as nearly as possible to the end of life, should be the next gerontological goal.

aq.auth: John W. Rowe and Robert L. Kahn

dt.t: Several genetic studies in mice suggest that the elimination of senescent cells from the organism leads to extension of the mouse's {wi}health span{/wi} and lifespan.

shortdef: the length of time in one's life during which an individual is in reasonably good health

dt: {bc}the average length of life of a kind of organism or of a material object especially in a particular environment or under specified circumstances
{bc}the duration of existence of an individual

shortdef: the average length of life of a kind of organism or of a material object especially in a particular environment or under specified circumstances
the duration of existence of an individual

et: short for {it}spick-and-span-new{/it}, from obsolete English {it}spick{/it} spike + English {it}and{/it} + {it}span-new{/it}
